intro: Dobrowskya scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf dobrowskya, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Dobrowskya scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
